atestar.meaning: To bear witness to [something] and affirm [it] to be true, or give proof of [something].
atestar.signification: Vider [alquó] e afirmar [su] veritá, o dar pruva de [alquó].

aparer.meaning: To seem [in a certain way], (chiefly visually), to have a [certain kind of] appearance.
aparer.signification: Semblar [in un cert maniere] (precipue visualmen), haver un [cert tip de] aparentie.
aparer.notes: Kemp and Pope separate the meanings of “appear” into [[aparer]] ([[semblar]]) and [[aparir]] ([[exposir]] se, o [[emerser]]).

aparir.meaning: To become visible, to come into vision.
aparir.notes: Kemp and Pope separate the meanings of “appear” into [[aparer]] ([[semblar]]) and [[aparir]] ([[exposir]] se, o [[emerser]]).

born.meaning: A limit, especially a physical border or boundary, (mathematics) a known maximum or minimum possible value.
born.signification: Un límite, precipue un fisic borde o frontiera, (matematica) un savet maximum o minimum possibil valore.
born.notes: Atestat quam ambi born e borne, ínafin al simil borde. Sovente plural.

bornar.meaning: To give bounds to [something], to limit [its] extent, or metaphorically of information, to narrow down the possible range of [something unknown].
bornar.signification: Dar bornes a [alquó], limitar [su] extension, o metaforicmen pri information, reducter li possibil extension de [alquó ínsavet].

carga.meaning: A load or burden, of physical weight to be carried.
carga.signification: Alquó que deve esser portat, un fisic pesa.
carga.notes: Could be used metaphorically, but Kemp and Pope propose [[charge]] for abstract burdens.

cargo.meaning: Something being transported, especially by boat, freight.
cargo.signification: Alquó que es transportat, precipue per nave, frete.
cargo.notes: Bears the logistical or legal sense, out of the trio of [[carga]], [[cargo]], and [[charge]]

cargar.meaning: To load [something] onto a means of transport or into a container, to load [a container] with things, (computing) to load into memory, (technology) to fill [a battery] or battery of [a device].
cargar.signification: Metter o posir [alquó] a un medie de transportation o in un scatulle, metter cosas in [un scatulle], (computation) mover se in memorie, (tecnologie) plenar [un batterie] o li batterie de un [machine].

charge.diacronic: F. charge, de F. charger, de L. carricāre
charge.meaning: Something which one must do or care for, a task or metaphorical burden.
charge.signification: Alquó que on deve far o cuidar, un tache o metaforic carga.
charge.notes: Bears the abstract sense compared to the literal [[carga]] and formal [[cargo]].

ciecar.meaning: To blind [someone], to daze or dazzle [someone]
ciecar.signification: Far ciec [alquí], dazlar o temporarimen stupefar [alquí]

cité.meaning: A town or populated place, likely a larger one.
cité.signification: Un borgo o populat loc, probabilmen un que es plu grand.
cité.notes: Languages and even specific countries have differing rules regarding when or whether a large enough town becomes classed as a city.

dazlar.meaning: To overpower [someone] with bright lights, or metaphorically to do likewise with a performance.
dazlar.signification: Subjugar [alquí] per fort luces, o metaforicmen far talmen per un performantie.

declarar.meaning: To announce and make known [something], usually with words.
declarar.signification: Anunciar e far conosset [alquó], usualmen con paroles.
declarar.notes: Litteralmen 'far clar', li signification in modern lingues es 'far conosset'. Por 'far clar', regarda [[aclarar]] o [[clarificar]].

detronar.meaning: To remove or drive [someone] from a throne, to remove [someone] from authority or dignity.
detronar.signification: Removar o fortiar [alquí] de un tron, removar [alquí] de autoritá o dignitá.

docer.meaning: To teach, to impart to [someone] [knowledge] or [how to do something], to guide and cause [learning].
docer.signification: Instructer, dar a [alquí] [saventie] o [per quo far alquó], ducter e causar [aprension].

efaciar.meaning: To cause [something impressed or inscribed upon a surface] to disappear by rubbing out, striking out, etc.; to erase; to render illegible or indiscernible.
efaciar.signification: Causar [alquó impresset o inscrit sur un superficie] desaparir per friction, trastrecation, etc.; eraser; causar que [alquó] es ínleibil o indiscernibil.
quotationes: On posse facilmen efaciar it per li gumme.
efaciar.notes: Stronger and more forceful than [[eraser]], appropriate for both literal and nonliteral meanings, note the negative counterpart [[defaciar]].

efaruchar.meaning: To scare off or frighten away (an animal), figuratively, to alarm or shock a person.

fascinar.meaning: To enchant or bewitch [someone], by extension to strongly enthrall the interest of [someone].
fascinar.signification: Charmar o insorciar [alquí], per extension fortmen subjugar li interest de [alquí].
fascinar.notes: The original meaning is magical, the intellectual meaning is modern but more common

frete.meaning: Originally, the price paid for transportation of goods, also the goods themselves or the task of transporting them.
frete.signification: Originalmen, li precie payat por li transportation de cargo, anc li cargo self, o li activitá de transporter le.
frete.notes: The rental fee meaning is present in all the European cognates, so [[cargo]] may be clearer to refer to transported goods rather than the occupation.

inculcar.meaning: To instill, impress, or ingrain [knowledge, feelings, or beliefs] within someone, to instill [an idea], with repetition and force.
inculcar.signification: Impresser o inplantar [idés, saventie, sentes, o credenties] intern alquí, con repetition e fortie.

ínter.meaning: Between [two or more things], or among [many things]

jurnale.meaning: A periodical publication, either for news or academic articles, or a diary/notebook for personal use.
jurnale.signification: Un periodical publication, sive por novas sive por academic articules, o un diarium/caderne por personal scrition.

regul.meaning: Something prescribed as governance for conduct or action, or an established or usual course or generalization.
regul.signification: Alquó que es prescrit quam guvernantie por conduida o action, o un etablisset o usual curse o generalisation.

saltar.meaning: To jump, to propel oneself up from the ground or down off from a high place with the legs.
saltar.signification: Propulse se ad-supra del suol o ad-infra de un alt loc con li gambes.

scrir.meaning: To form [some text] on a surface, or to create [a written work].
scrir.signification: Formar [alcun textu] sur un superficie, o crear [un scrit ovre].

tron.meaning: A chair of state, usually of a monarch, or metaphorically the power and role which the seat accompanies.
tron.signification: Un stul del state, usualmen de un monarch, o metaforicmen li potentie e rol quel li sede acompania.
